title: The "Colorful Mage Champion" might be a Vastaya from the Strig Tribe.
body:
According to the teaser, the champion will be able to shapeshift into different champions.
The teaser shows as well that the shapeshift may be often incomplete and can show what we can assume to be the champion's real appearance, this is especially visible with Ahri, as one of her tail is a reptile's. Other champions with shapeshift flaws have very floaty parts reminding of butterfly wings.

https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-kyJso7CD8uc/WP-c5uPot6I/AAAAAAABDC0/3Jo-arbkMporeh2R24iiqQfSL88T0YzlwCLcB/s1600/image.jpg

Now, looking at the Vastayan Tribes Tree, one of the tribe on top left have the definition of what is described above, "Reptilians Butterflies". 

So my guess is that the "Colorful Mage Champion" is from the Strig Vastayan Tribe.

EDIT: ~~Looks pretty much confirmed judging from her appearance.~~

EDIT2: Nvm she's from a new tribe called the Oovi-Kat

replies.body:
Yeah... I, too, am eyeing that "shapeshifter" flower out to the side.

But perhaps it isn't connected to the tree for a reason. Maybe every tribe has a certain % of shapeshifters?

> [{quoted}](name=KnightsKemplar,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=pNXMW9BP,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2018-11-18T20:22:13.946+0000)
>
> Yeah... I, too, am eyeing that "shapeshifter" flower out to the side.
> 
> But perhaps it isn't connected to the tree for a reason. Maybe every tribe has a certain % of shapeshifters?

I thought "Shapeshifters" refered to humans such as Nidalee?

> [{quoted}](name=Hextech OwI,realm=EUW,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=pNXMW9BP,comment-id=00020000,timestamp=2018-11-18T20:50:59.758+0000)
>
> I thought "Shapeshifters" refered to humans such as Nidalee?

All Vastaya are shapeshifters in a sense. Xayah and Rakan can change elements of their appearance but just never do before us. Nidalee and Udyr have diluted Vastayan blood in their veins and I guess the justification for that is that they can transform, but only in very regimented ways. Nidalee can only turn into the same cougar, and Udyr can change his arms into animalistic forms using animal spirit, even old Swain was Vastayan for a little while this too was reflected in his transformation into a scary birb thing. Xayah and Rakan can probably change more free form: color, feather density and the like.

That's why I think this a pure Vastayashai'rei with every deviation in the gene pool a bit of the willful shapeshifting ability goes away. I like what this does to the whole Vastaya dynamic because Xayah and Rakan looked down on Swain, Nidalee and Udyr.

Rakan to Udyr "It is from our blood your gifts came, and my hand that took it back."
Rakan to Swain "You were given Vastayan blood, yet chose to be blind."

When they themselves are essentially slightly purer mutts of what they idolize. Then they get angry at Ionian humans for persecuting them while Ionian nationals are pissed off at Noxus for oppressing them signaling this cycle of hatred that really has nothing to do with what people do to one another, but more to do with drawing lines between who is "us" and who is "they".

It paints them as hypocrites which is interesting what could only make this better is that if the new champ is a pure Vastayashai'rei and is disinterested by Xayahs' passionate distaste of humans or puzzled by her prideful claiming of a bloodline.

If she does shapeshift into other champs, I'm hoping her taunts are imitation/mockery of the champs in question.

To Yasuo: "*fake gruff voice* I don't deserve a name, but it is Yasuo. I walk a lonely road. The only one that I have ever known."
To Riven: "My weapon is a metaphor for my soul. I don't know if I made that clear."
To Zoe: "Oooh, I'm Zoe, I'm so short that I'm jealous of all tall people. JUST MAKE YOURSELF TALLER!"
To Xayah: "Grr, I'm Xayah, and i hate dem dirty humies for being afraid of what I refuse to explain to any of them!"
To Garen: "I AM GAREN AND I LOVE DEMACIAAAAA!! ...Okay that's actually kinda fun. DEMACIA! DEMACIA DEMACIA!!!"
To Kayn: "I'm the emo kid and his barely-functional gardening tool."
To Vi: "Vi: Stands for six. The number of seconds I'm gonna need."
To Ekko: "I'm a brilliant inventor with a girl's name."
To Teemo: "... I got nothing. You are the worst."
To Amumu: "WAH WAH WAH, I'M AMUMU, I'M SUCH A CRYBA- oh. oh no, no, don't cry, I'm just messing with you- ... Shit."

Or something like that.
That is the joke, yes :P

For Zoe, could turn into Ezreal and say something along the lines of not being interested in her.

Idk that feels a little too personal mean though.  Maybe instead imitate Lux calling out cheerfully to Ezreal?

Ah... perhaps so. 

Or, nidalee could be retconned into a vastaya. We don't have super up to date lore for her, do we?

> [{quoted}](name=KnightsKemplar,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=pNXMW9BP,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2018-11-18T20:22:13.946+0000)

That's for half-Vastayas, isn't it? Like the pig-man from the Santangelo journal.

YES! YES! YES!
PLEASE.
Also hopefully it's not just a pretty woman with a tail and wings... please... let it not be a pretty woman with a tail and wings...

... It's going to be a pretty woman with a tail and wings... isn't it?
Eh. I'm prepared to be _solcrushed_. (badum tss)

I'm hoping for something more along the lines of a Rengar-level Vastaya. Or, at least, something more animal than human.

Probably going to be a hot chick with wings and a tail, though. Maybe claws too.

However, with Kai'sa, riot has proven that there is a reason to worry.

are shapeshifters their own tribe or race? they aren’t included on the tree but are placed next to it instead. if this is true then the champion can’t be from the strig tribe because it’s not actually from a vastayan tribe

> [{quoted}](name=imgrabe,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=pNXMW9BP,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2018-11-18T20:13:22.238+0000)

Isn't it just an indication that Vastayans (or some of them) are shapeshifters? Like. It's not on the tree because it's just something all of them can be.

> [{quoted}](name=Vartius,realm=EUNE,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=pNXMW9BP,comment-id=00010000,timestamp=2018-11-18T20:14:36.522+0000)
>
> Isn't it just an indication that Vastayans (or some of them) are shapeshifters? Like. It's not on the tree because it's just something all of them can be.

possibly

Shapeshifters are vastaya/human hybrids(Nidalee is pretty much confirmed to be one),they usually look human,but have the ability to morph into an animal form very quickly.
They aren't really tied to that tree,since they are likely closer to humans than vastaya.

I think that it was explained that humans with an incredibly small amount of Vastaya DNA can turn into the animal the Vastaya is based on. Nidalee falls into that camp, not magical enough to be Vastaya and be have all their abilities but has enough Vastayan ancestry to change into a cougar.

That depends on the shape shifting ability itself. The champion may be causing hallucinations or some other form of illusion to appear to be something that it isn't, like how a green chameleon sitting completely still could be mistaken for a leaf. Mimicry and illusion are different from true shape shifting, since they don't actually change what they are, just what they _appear_ to be.

> [{quoted}](name=4 Step Cadence,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=pNXMW9BP,comment-id=00010001,timestamp=2018-11-18T20:17:27.359+0000)

The champion may be causing hallucinations or some other form of illusion to appear to be something that it isn't, like how a green chameleon sitting completely still could be mistaken for a leaf. Mimicry and illusion are different from true shape shifting, since they don't actually change what they are, just what they _appear_ to be.

i feel like they are most definitely shapeshifting because it would be weird if the character could only create accurate illusions for only some characters. the vines and the mist that appears on the “illusions/hallucinations” make it seem like the new characters just transformed into them but it’s imperfect and they can’t hide the transformation completely
are they going to release the new champ on pre season or on season 9?
Well the reveal is tomorrow/the 19th, so I imagine they're getting released not too long after that.
going on PBE for next cycle.
Nah, pretty sure she is a plant mage and from Kumungu.

{{champion:143}}?
_15 RP say's it's going to be able to turn into other champs temporarily._

~~Jk, probably was easy to guess anyway~~

Because i keep seeing everyone talk about this champ being a shape shifter. they arn't. 
in the video its showing off darius, nunu and ahri and what bothers them the most emotionally.
darius lost his wife
nunu lost his mom
and ahri believes she is a monster

the champ isnt shape shifting, they are showing the champions greatest emotional trauma

> [{quoted}](name=sirus otter,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=pNXMW9BP,comment-id=000b,timestamp=2018-11-19T14:08:25.702+0000)

> in the video its showing off darius, nunu and ahri and what bothers them the most emotionally.
> darius lost his wife
> nunu lost his mom
> and ahri believes she is a monster
> 
> the champ isnt shape shifting, they are showing the champions greatest emotional trauma

That doesn't make sense.

Why would Nunu represent the loss of his mother as himself? 
Since Ahri already sees herself as a monster, why would she further self represent as another monster or something she isn't (which is actually what she might want to be, not herself)? 
Darius having an emotional trauma about his wife by looking at a flower seems like a big jump to a conclusion.

And all these floaty bits look like imperfect transformation to me.
uhm... do you have any idea what your even talking about. honest question

> [{quoted}](name=sirus otter,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=pNXMW9BP,comment-id=000b00010000,timestamp=2018-11-19T14:28:12.167+0000)

Not more than you. This is all speculation and we can only theorize until the champion is revealed.
I present to you why I don't think you're right, now is your job to further the discussion by presenting more arguments.

eh fair.
basically what me and a few friends think is that the mage is going to be either a sabateur (meaning a debuff or debilitation mage) or a support mid laner kinda like how ivern is a support jngler. she will either increase your fears and worries or take them away basically

the art in the video shows darius seeming to mourn over somthing which yes what that is, is technically a stretch however nunu's mom died, and it shows him going to hug her. 
ahri believes she is a monster and its what she hates about herself and its what bothers her. those two things cant be coincadental, ontop of darius mourning his wife did die, what else would he be mourning with a flower? you place flowers on peoples graves.

it just seems more like the champion is showing off what is most emotionally taxing on the champions

It's not Nunu's mother, it's some sort of doppelganger of Nunu himself. He's not going to hug him, he is surprised to see it.
As I said, I think you're jumping to conclusion to fast.
its... clearly his mother... they are two different people in the painting.  this should be obvious to anyone who can see and has read nunus lore.

however. somone pointed out that the teaser for the new champ and the leaks match up to support the shape shift entirely.

ahri has a chameleon tail in the painting and nunus mom has the headdress that the leaked champion has in the Chinese leak 

if its a real leak then it would 100% support the shape-shift theory

This is Nunu and another Nunu. We don't know how her mom looks like. I doubt she would wear the exact same outfit as him. And yes, I've read his lore. I was the one who found out that Laika, her mother, is also the one singing in Ornn's teaser.
That... is actually a really interesting interpretation of it. I guess we'll see in a few hours.
